author: Obsidian Wolf

text:
First off, I'd like to say thank you very much for the contributions you've made (the music uploaded). I always play randomly one of your playlists everyday and shuffle them.

To the main point, like you, I'm also missing it so I did some random googles about Wild Arms. I've read about rumors how media vision had job listings. The production seem to have started just around late 2010's maybe early 2011's. So definitely waiting for the series in ps3!
author: skyjlv

text: Sounds a bit like something from InuYasha...
author: ShinRyuuI

text: This theme sounds a bit French.. beautiful nonetheless.  just imagine this theme playing as you walk down the streets of Paris as you admire your sorroundings  .. magnificent.
author: Kira P

text: @thapoint09 yes... :3
author: Lorde Sinclair

text: @Lux019 Well, Capcom LOVES bringing series back years later, specially seems to be 10 years later with all their stuff. (MVSC, Megaman, Street Fighter, horror based Resident Evil). Breath Of Fire 5 came out in 2005. I know this will be painful to hear(pains me to even say it)but, let's give em another 5 years. If not, then maybe it'll be a Ghosts N Goblins/Bionic Commando scenario of waiting 20 years and we have 15 left. But Capcom did start the trend of bringing back dead series so hey! Smiles!

text:
Is it really dead? Maybe one day we'll wake up, and out of nowhere... THE news : Wild Arms 6 is coming out! OMG!! 

Until then, lets enjoy Miss Naruke's work!
author: Boyce18

text:
This series may be dead,but it will continue to be in our memories.
The soundtrack is one of the many things why this series is so epic.
author: LightFykki

text: @gmrpg2 4 introduced a new battle system which was awkward and it's probably the worst of the series but 5 did things to fix the battle system and was an alright game, though not as good as the first 3.
author: assgoblin2damax

text: @Koopsas He can just upload the songs to a random site for uploading. then link the location in comment.
author: Rikku yo

text: @SupraDarky Don't be sad. No series is ever 100% dead. Punch Out!! was gone for almost 20 years when someone at Nintendo thought it shouldn't have died and we got the new entry last year! Chrono should've died in 2000 but got a new small entry(with about an hours worth of new content) in 2008. Marvel VS Capcom was huge, but Marvel was then owned by another company and yet despite that we're seeing somethign new! I can go on! No series is ever dead! It just matters how soon the next entry hits...
author: Arc13

text:
@SupraDarky There aren't any more WildARMS?  Why?  I love it! Granted, I have only played the first one, but I still love it.  Thank you for hooking me onto the series.

(and thanks for this channel. So much good music)
